My therapist said she‚Äôs not supposed to have feelings. How are you supposed to deal with that? She said if she had feelings, she would be a bad therapist. Has anyone else experienced this?
It is possible that your therapist wanted to explain that she cannot mix subjectivity with professional expertise. You consult a therapist to gain a better understanding of your personal experience, situation, difficulty and you need to know that your therapist is not reacting as someone who is on your side as a friend or judgemental. We train to handle what the patient is experiencing with knowledge and qualification, not with emotions. Asking your therapist about personal involvement will neither help you or give her the trust in her expertise you need to work towards solutions or comprehension.
